intro: Mukia, commonly known as the Indian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinctive botanical feature. The plant typically grows as a shrub or a small tree, with opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. Mukia is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
